title: [Regression] Cannot frame iPad Pro (12.9-inch) (2nd generation) screenshots
body:
### New Issue Checklist - [X] Updated fastlane to the latest version - [X] I read the [Contribution Guidelines](https://github.com/fastlane/fastlane/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) - [X] I read [docs.fastlane.tools](https://docs.fastlane.tools) - [X] I searched for [existing GitHub issues](https://github.com/fastlane/fastlane/issues) ### Issue Description I have a few iPad Pro (12.9-inch) (2nd generation) screenshots that I cannot get framed - named `iPad Pro (12.9-inch) (2nd generation) - 0PrivateFees.png` etc. I have searched previous issues - including, but not limited to: https://github.com/fastlane/frameit-frames/issues/22 https://github.com/fastlane/frameit-frames/issues/18 #16513 #14713 It appears at one stage this was [fixed in a PR, but then overridden](https://github.com/fastlane/frameit-frames/pull/17). Anyone know why? ##### Command executed `fastlane frameit` ##### Complete output when running fastlane, including the stack trace and command used
Relevant part: ``` [âœ”] ðŸš€ [19:35:42]: Get started using a Gemfile for fastlane https://docs.fastlane.tools/getting-started/ios/setup/#use-a-gemfile [19:35:43]: Using device frames version 'latest' [â ‹] Framing screenshot './en-US/iPad Pro (12.9-inch) (2nd generation) - 0PrivateFees.png' [19:35:43]: Couldn't find template for screenshot type 'Apple iPad Pro Space Gray' [19:35:43]: Please run `fastlane frameit download_frames` to download the latest frames [â ‹] Framing screenshot './en-US/iPad Pro (12.9-inch) (2nd generation) - 1BusinessFees.png' [19:35:43]: Couldn't find template for screenshot type 'Apple iPad Pro Space Gray' [19:35:43]: Please run `fastlane frameit download_frames` to download the latest frames [â ‹] Framing screenshot './en-US/iPad Pro (12.9-inch) (2nd generation) - 2Utilities.png' [19:35:43]: Couldn't find template for screenshot type 'Apple iPad Pro Space Gray' [19:35:43]: Please run `fastlane frameit download_frames` to download the latest frames ```
